metadata.description:
In early 2021 I regained control over my publishing from Universal Music, created my first blockchain music project, and never looked back. 

The nearly 2 decades prior to this pivot were a long, strange trip through creative innovation that began when I won the inaugural YouTube Award for Best Music Video for my song “Say It’s Possible.” I went on to release my first album with Universal Music Publishing and Island Records followed by a string of independent releases, and toured for the majority of the next decade, playing everywhere from Wembley Stadium and historic opera houses across Italy to smokey pubs and people’s living rooms. It was a wild ride to say the least. 

I struggled to make ends meet, in spite of licensing dozens of songs to film and television and touring all over the US and Europe. I tried just about every crowd funding platform, including Pledge Music, Indiegogo and Patreon. The concept of “turning your biggest fans into your marketing team” felt inherently flawed without any real incentive for listeners to spend their valuable time promoting my music. 

And then, in 2020, I discovered the nascent tools of web3 and was filled with a renewed sense of hope – the framework was finally in place to create a mutually beneficial relationship between artist and fan. 

In the process of creating my own audiovisual NFT projects, I discovered a passion for guiding and advising at all levels of interest and experience, from the web3 curious to blockchain natives, creatives to executives. 

I became an advisor to Async Art and led Community, Marketing, and Strategic Partnerships for Authentic Artists' WVRPS by WarpSound which remains the number one music collection on OpenSea since its launch in January 2021. I helped launch Async Art’s “Blueprints” tool with collections by top crypto artists XCOPY, Coldie and Alotta Money, as well as generative code artist Kenny Vaden’s collections with OpenSea, Flamingo DAO, and Quantum Art. I joined XPRIZE as web3 Lead, helping to pioneer groundbreaking use cases for blockchain technology in fundraising and philanthropy. 

And now it’s time to funnel some of my creative energy back into my own art. 

“Get Mine” is a reflection on being an artist in the crypto space, a commentary on the late stage capitalist world we inhabit, a reflection on the experience of meeting my own shadow. 

It’s a deeply personal song that I hope will resonate with so many of us in this space and I hope you love it. 

Thank you for reading...and listening...and being early :)

lyrics.text:
Met you at a party
You drove a Maserati
Said you got fuck you money now

And nobody liked you
When you sang sad folk songs
But now they all want you around

And I know that I’m petty
I know I’m unkind
Keep saying I’ll do better
When I get mine

Working real hard 
To get nowhere I wanna be
Only made sense for so long

And if all my needs were met
Maybe I’d hate life less
Maybe I’d write better songs

And I know when I started
I felt I had time
But now my intentions 
Are just to get mine

And I am over the dread
I’m over this country
I’m over being in over my head

Living in a late stage capitalist nightmare
That is what my daddy said

Where people like me
Could be writing ‘bout love
But we’re writing ‘bout money instead

And I try to be patient
I try to keep trying
Keep saying I’ll do better
When I get mine…

metadata.name: Get Mine (acoustic) #1
metadata.title: Get Mine (acoustic)
